wikipedia_page.main:
William Ingram Bryant (1 March 1899 – 21 January 1986) was an English international footballer who played club football for Clapton and Millwall. Born in Ghent, Belgium, Bryant played as a centre half.
Whilst a Clapton player Bryant was capped by England, in a match against France in May 1925. It was to be his only England appearance.Bryant first played a Football League match for Millwall in the 1925–26 season and he went on to play over 130 League games for the Lions.He died in Witham in 1986.
